meanings.definition: To fasten or secure with a nail.
meanings.sent1: He nailed the picture to the wall.
meanings.sent2: She always nails the loose boards back in place.
meanings.sent3: The carpenter accidentally nailed his thumb instead of the wood.
meanings.sent4: Her words nailed the truth of the matter.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the hammer nailing echoed through the room.

meanings.definition: To hit or strike with great accuracy.
meanings.sent1: The archer nailed the bullseye from a distance.
meanings.sent2: He nailed the target right in the center.
meanings.sent3: The baseball pitcher accidentally nailed the batter on the arm.
meanings.sent4: Her aim was so precise, she nailed every shot.
meanings.sent5: The dart player nailed the perfect throw to win the game.

meanings.definition: To succeed in accomplishing or achieving something.
meanings.sent1: She nailed the presentation and impressed everyone.
meanings.sent2: He nailed the interview and got the job.
meanings.sent3: The student nailed the exam, surprising even the teacher.
meanings.sent4: Their teamwork nailed the project deadline.
meanings.sent5: The athlete nailed the final jump, securing the gold medal.
